Gamers over age 35 now 40% of the game market!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Gamers over age 35 now 40% of the game market!
By Lisa Shock on Thursday, October 10, 2002 - 08:05 pm:

So many times, at other sites, I see people (ok teens) posting that they are amazed that I am over 40 and still play games. Quite often the comments are not positive. Term most often used is "pathetic".

My perspective has always been that I started gaming in my teens on mainframes, and as games evolved, I tried a little bit of everything. And, it's been wonderful fun. My standard reply, if I bother with the small-minded, is "when exactly do you plan on stop buying games?"

Anyway, I always knew I wasn't alone. A large percent of MRM's regulars are over 30, and I have always seen adults buying games for themselves. Here's a news article with more details. Now if the game industry would recognise us, and start making/marketing games for us, instead of assuming that we only play yahtzee.

By mepersoner on Thursday, October 10, 2002 - 08:30 pm:
